body_html: My guess is that more ops than before are now supported on GPU, so there may be more copying of data between CPU and GPU if you are not careful (e.g., you set allow_soft_placement=True, which means surprising placement decisions could be made :). Try turning on log_device_placement in the ConfigProto to see what might have changed.
body_text: My guess is that more ops than before are now supported on GPU, so there may be more copying of data between CPU and GPU if you are not careful (e.g., you set allow_soft_placement=True, which means surprising placement decisions could be made :).  Try turning on log_device_placement in the ConfigProto to see what might have changed.
body: My guess is that more ops than before are now supported on GPU, so there may be more copying of data between CPU and GPU if you are not careful (e.g., you set allow_soft_placement=True, which means surprising placement decisions could be made :).  Try turning on log_device_placement in the ConfigProto to see what might have changed.
